snippet: If teenage sleepovers have really become a question of when, not if, across the country, then things have changed — maybe for the better, but in ways my friends and I, slipping out of windows and parking out by the lake, could never have imagined.
abstract: If teenage sleepovers have really become a question of when, not if, across the country, then things have changed — maybe for the better, but in ways my friends and I, slipping out of windows and parking out by the lake, could never have imagined.

headline.main: Are Teenage Boyfriend-Girlfriend 'Sleepovers' the New Norm?
